option.name: C2P-Diagram
option.description: Graphische representation (Diagram) eines Elements oder mehrere Elementen.

option.name: C2P-Operational Capability
option.description: An Operational Capability

option.name: C2P-Operational Entity
option.description: An Operational Entity

option.name: C2P-Operational Activity
option.description: An Operational Activity

option.name: C2P-Operational Interaction
option.description: Die "Operational Interaction" ist Capella-intern als "Functional Exchange" abgebildet und bezeichnet den Datenaustausch, welche zwischen den Operational Activities statt findet.

option.name: C2P-System Actor
option.description: Beschreibt ein eine external Entität welche mit dem System interagiert.

option.name: C2P-System Capability
option.description: Bezeichnet die Fähigkeit vom System einen Service zur Verfügung zu stellen, welches die Erfüllung von operationalen Activities unterstützt.

option.name: C2P-Capability Realization
option.description: Bezeichnet die Fähigkeit vom System einen Service zur Verfügung zu stellen, welches die Erfüllung von System Capabilities unterstützt.

option.name: C2P-System Component
option.description: Beschreibt ein System oder Teile davon.

option.name: C2P-System Function
option.description: Beschreibt eine Funktionalität des Systems welche in der Regel eine oder mehrere Operational Activities verfeinert.

option.name: C2P-System Functional Exchange
option.description: Bezeichnet der Informationsaustausch zwischen System Functions.

option.name: C2P-Logical Functional Exchange
option.description: Bezeichnet der Informationsaustausch zwischen Logical Functions.

option.name: C2P-Functional Chain
option.description: A Functional Chain is a mean to describe one specific path among all possible paths traversing the dataflow, either to describe an expected behavior of the System in a given context, or in order to express some non functional properties along this functional path (latency, criticality, confidentiality, redundancy...). An elementary Functional Chain is made of a succession of Functions and Exchanges across a functional dataflow, starting and ending with a Function (allocated to the System or to an Actor).

option.name: C2P-System Component Exchange
option.description: Repräsentiert die Verbindung zwischen zwei System-Komponenten, oder Zwischen einer System-Komponente und einem System-Aktor.

option.name: C2P-Logical Component Exchange
option.description: Repräsentiert die Verbindung zwischen zwei Logical-Komponenten, oder Zwischen einer Logical-Komponente und einem Logical-Aktor.

option.name: C2P-Logical Component
option.description: Beschreibt die Logische Bestandteile des Systems als "white box", ohne Technologie Behaftung.

option.name: C2P-Logical Actor
option.description: Logische Entität welche mit System-Komponente(n) interagiert.

option.name: C2P-Logical Function
option.description: Funktion beschrieben in der Logischen Architektur. Sie verfeinert in der Regel eine oder Mehrere Funktionen in der System Architektur.

option.name: C2P-Exchange Item
option.description: Beschreibt ein Set von konsistenten Daten unter Betrachtung eines Verwendungskontextes.

option.name: C2P-Class
option.description: Beschreibt die Struktur und Inhalt von Informationen.

option.name: C2P-State Machine
option.description: Each set of Modes or States linked to each other by transitions is named a finite State Machine. A Mode or State ‘A’ can be decomposed into sub-modes (and possibly sub-states) Ai. Entering a Mode or State can: Enable or disable the activation of Functions (which might be only available in some Modes or States) Modify some attributes of Functions or Components (e.g. non functional properties) Modify global Data in the model.

option.name: C2P-Communication Mean
option.description: Communication Means have a slightly different meaning according to the followed model strategy. When following Arcadia, Component Exchanges basically connect Components (through Component Ports) and carry Functional Exchanges between the source and target Components. Their Kind in that case is set to FLOW. In a context where Components are reusable (i.e. can be used to type several Parts), Component Exchanges also serve to connect Parts (and thus, not directly Components at Type level). Their Kind in that case is set to ASSEMBLY. Component Exchanges are also used technically to model Delegation between Component Ports (in that case, their Kind is set to DELEGATION).

option.name: C2P-Constraint
option.description: A Constraint gives access to the specification.

option.name: C2P-Scenario
option.description: Scenarios describe dynamic, time-related interactions between elements: Operational Entities and Actors, the System itself, the System Components. These interactions are expressed through temporally ordered Sequence Messages.

option.name: C2P-Physical Path
option.description: A Physical Path is an ordered set of Physical Links conveying a Component Exchange.

option.name: C2P-Physical Link
option.description: Physical Links are the communication/transportation means linking Node Physical Components. They carry the Component Exchanges existing between the Behavior Physical Components.

option.name: C2P-Physical Actor
option.description: External entity (user, operator or other system) interacting directly with the System under study.

option.name: C2P-Physical Function
option.description: A System/Logical/Physical Function is an action, an operation or a service fulfilled by one Component or Actor. It has input and output Ports, respectively targets and sources of Functional Exchanges (information, data, material, fluid, etc.).

option.name: C2P-Physical Component Behavior
option.description: A Component is a constituent part of either the System or Internal Actors. He contributes to their behavior, properties and characteristics, by interacting with other Components and with both Internal and External Actors.

option.name: C2P-Physical Component Node
option.description: A Component is a constituent part of either the System or Internal Actors. He contributes to their behavior, properties and characteristics, by interacting with other Components and with both Internal and External Actors.

option.name: C2P-Physical Component
option.description: A Component is a constituent part of either the System or Internal Actors. He contributes to their behavior, properties and characteristics, by interacting with other Components and with both Internal and External Actors.

option.name: C2P-State
option.description: The State of an element characterizes the element behavior in given environmental conditions. A State is activated mainly by external conditions, or by operators. It may be unexpected and even suffered.
